discussion.content: If the time on the computer's clock is outside of this range, the user will be unable to log in to the domain. Therefore answer is A.

Selected Answer: A
Various methods have been devised to correct drift. The simplest and most reliable way is to implement Network Time Protocol (NTP) and receive accurate time signals from a server that is dedicated to that task and maintained to a very high standard of accuracy.30 Nov 2023

Selected Answer: A
When your server's time doesn't match an authoritative time, such as ntp.org, you have a problem called time drift. This problem is incredibly common and happens slowly over weeks and months. To easily check the time drift, compare the server's current date and time to The Official NIST Time.
Time Drift: Gradual difference or offset between a computer's system clock and the accurate time maintained by a reference time source or a time server.
CompTia states that if a users log in is failing on one device but not on the other, its time drift.

Selected Answer: A
Having an incorrect, out of range, time will cause connection issues in both the intranet and internet. So, A is most likely the answer.

questions.question_text: A user is unable to log in to the domain with a desktop PC, but a laptop PC is working properly on the same network. A technician logs in to the desktop PC with a local account but is unable to browse to the secure intranet site to get troubleshooting tools. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the issue?

discussion.content:
B. Internet Options
Internet Options is the correct place to check and modify proxy settings in Internet Explorer and other Windows applications. By accessing the Internet Options dialog box, the technician can verify whether a proxy server is configured and, if so, whether the correct settings are being used.

If a proxy server is configured incorrectly or unnecessarily, it can significantly impact internet speeds. The technician can either disable the proxy server or ensure that it is configured correctly to optimize internet performance.

Google Gemini

questions.question_text: Internet speeds on a user's Windows 10 device are slow, but other devices on the same network are running at normal speeds. A technician thinks the issue may be related to the proxy settings. Which of the following should the technician check to verify the proxy configuration?

discussion.content:
B. Rootkit
A rootkit is a type of malware that can hide its presence and other malicious software from security tools, including antivirus software. It can modify system files and processes to prevent the detection and removal of itself and other malware.

In this case, the rootkit may have disabled Windows Defender to avoid detection and allow the attacker to maintain control of the system.

Google Gemini

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a PC that will not run Windows Defender. Windows Defender has been disabled and no other antivirus is installed on the PC. Which of the following would have caused this issue?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Yeah this question leaves a lot to be desired. I would think since the tech has attempted to remove the malware a few times that the computer has already been taken of the network. I would Reimage the computer (A) and put the computer in safe mode (D). That's just me though.

Selected Answer: AC
A. Reimage the computer.
Reimaging the computer involves wiping the system and restoring it to a clean state, ensuring that any remaining malware is removed.

C. Remove the computer from the network.
Disconnecting the computer from the network prevents the malware from spreading further or communicating with external servers, reducing the risk of further compromise.

These steps focus on ensuring the malware is fully removed and minimizing the potential for additional damage.

Selected Answer: AB
All the other options are stuff you should have already done if you've attempted to remove the malware a few times.

questions.question_text: A computer has been infected with malware. Despite several attempts to remove the malware, the issue persists. Which of the following actions should the technician take next? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Remove the computer from the network.
choices.D: Put the computer in safe mode.
choices.B: Restore the computer using the last known-good backup.

questions.question_text: A change was introduced in the company's DNS server, but local workstations have not applied it yet. Which of the following commands should the help desk technician use to force the workstations to immediately apply the change?

discussion.content:
D. ipconfig /flushdns
The ipconfig /flushdns command clears the DNS resolver cache on a Windows system. This forces the system to refresh its DNS cache and obtain the latest DNS information, including any changes to DNS records. By running this command on the workstations, the technician can ensure that they are using the updated DNS information and can resolve domain names correctly.

Google Gemini
sounds like this is missing gpupdate.
